body: duplicate with #2904

Apache ShardingSphere is not a all-in-one solution, just like MySQL do not support password encryption.
So, what do you think about Apache ShardingSphere's scope?
What is the error message log?

What situation can let queryResults empty?
The queryResults at least has one element. If no element for queryResults, exception `no table route info` will happen from route module.

The exception `More than one table found in namespace` has thrown from hibernate.
Maybe can help you: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36907095/more-than-one-table-found-in-namespace-schemaextractionexception
Can you try to 4.0.0-RC3?
What is different between `special` table name and `normal` table name?

Can you try to analyze and just provide related code with database access code? 
For example, the code of `ssl` and `log` is too confuse for debug.
No, all sharding strategy should written by developers.
`date_format` of sharding can not support, because all sharding values must parse from SQL. But the function `date_format` need calculate from database.
@HongJinFeng Thank you, assigned.
FIY: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/tree/4.0.0-RC2
Closed because no response for long time
Closed because no response for long time.

But is no message logs....

> What is the error message log?

But is no message logs .

My compose file like

version: '3.1'
services:
  sharding-proxy:
    image: apache/sharding-proxy:latest
    container_name: sharding-proxy
    ports:
      - 13308:3308

and running:

Starting sharding-proxy ... done
Attaching to sharding-proxy
sharding-proxy exited with code 0

But 4.0.0-RC2 do not have this problem .

Can you submit a test-case to reproduce this issue, thx. 
@TonyLuo

@terrymanu  @kimmking pls refer to this repository : https://github.com/TonyLuo/test-shardingsphere
After server started, you can run following command to reproduce this issue:

```
curl 'http://localhost:8080/api/authenticate' -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8' -H 'Accept: application/json, text/plain, */*'  --data-binary '{"username":"admin","password":"admin","rememberMe":false}'
```
@itxiaole What's mean of `across libraries`?
You can check the log file first, it should has hints in the log
@SteNicholas thank you, assigned.
There is no difference；these table is important in our system that we want route all the sql to master
Has your problem solved?

@tmjGitAccount Your understood exists mistake. `RoutingEngineFactory.newInstance()` should return `StandardRoutingEngine`, and call method `route()` to load your algorithm. Here isn't through `DatabaseHintRoutingEngine`.

@tmjGitAccount What's more, `DatabaseHintRoutingEngine` isn't used in any routing case and modules. Therefore, the `DatabaseHintRoutingEngine` is necessary to remove. Where load your algorithm is that `StandardRoutingEngine` calls method `route()` to load user-defined algorithm.

@terrymanu 
These is no message logs, and I run docker inspect command for the exited container:
```
...
"Config": {
	"Cmd": [
		"/bin/sh"
	],
	"Entrypoint": null,
	...
}
...
```

this container seems only run a shell

@terrymanu 
I try to extract docker image as plain files, and found the official image is only contains a java environment without shardingsphere proxy execute file.

> @tmjGitAccount What's more, `DatabaseHintRoutingEngine` isn't used in any routing case and modules. Therefore, the `DatabaseHintRoutingEngine` is necessary to remove. Where load your algorithm is that `StandardRoutingEngine` calls method `route()` to load user-defined algorithm.

@SteNicholas  
Thx for your reply, but there is still something wrong for me, 
As you can see My perpose is to get sth from session  to hint the datasource.

1. if my conf is like what i  offered before, it will new a DefaultDatabaseRoutingEngine as follows, it always hint my defaultDatabase.
RoutingEngineFactory:83
```
if (shardingRule.isAllInDefaultDataSource(tableNames)) {
            return new DefaultDatabaseRoutingEngine(shardingRule, tableNames);
        }
```
2.then i add  some confs for tables,confs are as follows: 
```
tables:
        my_table:
          database-strategy:
            hint:
              algorithm-class-name: a.b.c.OrderShardingAlgorithm
          table-strategy:
            hint:
              algorithm-class-name: a.b.c.OrderShardingAlgorithm
```
then  the  factory can  create a  StandardRoutingEngine  instance,  
and the codes  execute as 
**route()  ->  
getDataNodes() -> 
routeByHint() -> 
route0() -> 
getDatabaseShardingValuesFromHint() -> 
routeDataSources() ->
 myalgorithm.dosharding()**
i don't know if it's the correct way , but currently the method **getDatabaseShardingValuesFromHint()**  always retruns  an empty list  and then  the method **routeDataSources()** won't execute my algorithm, it returns directly.
```
public static Collection<Comparable<?>> getDatabaseShardingValues(final String logicTable) {
        return null == HINT_MANAGER_HOLDER.get() ? Collections.<Comparable<?>>emptyList() : HINT_MANAGER_HOLDER.get().databaseShardingValues.get(logicTable);
    }
```
this code compares my databases with table's name , so it always retruns empty.
```
HINT_MANAGER_HOLDER.get().databaseShardingValues.get(logicTable)
```
so i don't know if  i lost some conf or others , could u please help me for this. 😃

@tmjGitAccount Because you didn't execute `HintAddDatabaseShardingValueCommand` command like `sctl:hint addDatabaseShardingValue xx=yy.`.
@tmjGitAccount You only through `sctl:hint addDatabaseShardingValue xx=yy` to execute `HintAddDatabaseShardingValueCommand `, then `HintAddDatabaseShardingValueExecutor` will execute this command.
FIY: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example
@fenghuanfun Here should provide SPI sharding interface adapter to user-defined function, so this issue could be closed by @terrymanu. We could talk this in issue #3799.

please replay my CI, thanks!

all example the defaultTableStrategy is none.

dynamic parameter  => actual_fee = actual_fee + VALUES(actual_fee)

eg.. 
db — actual_fee = 2

parameter — 5

exec:

ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE actual_fee = actual_fee + VALUES(actual_fee)

then

db — actual_fee = 7

please try it!



> 在 2019年12月23日，09:20，zhaoyongsheng1990 <notifications@github.com> 写道：
> 
> VALUES(#{actualFee})

> dynamic parameter => actual_fee = actual_fee + VALUES(actual_fee) eg.. db — actual_fee = 2 parameter — 5 exec: ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE actual_fee = actual_fee + VALUES(actual_fee) then db — actual_fee = 7 please try it!
> […](#)
> 在 2019年12月23日，09:20，zhaoyongsheng1990 ***@***.***> 写道： VALUES(#{actualFee})

I change mapper file like this：
actual_fee = actual_fee + VALUES(actual_fee),
it worked  , thanks very much.

does not need this change , it worked with refers to the value of col_name, in mysql docs says:
  In assignment value expressions in the ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE clause, you can use the VALUES(col_name) function to refer to column values from the INSERT portion of the INSERT ... ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE statement. In other words, VALUES(col_name) in the ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE clause refers to the value of col_name that would be inserted, had no duplicate-key conflict occurred. 
thanks .

If insert value is different from update value, such as:
```
INSERT INTO table_a (id,col_1,col_2) VALUES(1,#{bean.val1}, #{bean.val2}) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE col_2 = col_2 + #{bean.val5}
```
Is the syntax already supported?  @lonyee1989 @terrymanu

Yeah,this issue should really be described as a support integrity issue for mybatis.Under mybatis, you do lose the variable after 'ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE'. Just watching the discussion, by the way.

@tuohai666 
1. mysql-connector-java-5.1.42.jar
2. test application is created using java
3. mysql 5.7
4. the configuration is already included, please refer to the previous section.

Our purpose of using this project is not to split one table to multiple databases.
Our purpose is to limit the data access by applying some where/value limitations.
So I hard coded to create a TransparentSchema.

Previously I think if there is only one datasource in a configuration, a TransparentSchema will be used. Maybe my idea is wrong. 
So I'm sorry I can not help.
It's OK. I'll fix this issue soon.

@xiyelife Hi boy, we need your support. This issue blocks our coming release!

This PR rollbacks one commit to solve #3770 , which makes one unit test in [your PR](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/3768) perform wrong .
Currenty we have to ignore this unit test, so could you give a look at it and make it run well again?
Looking forward to your reply, Thx.

the problem is that when i want to use HintManager in some place, i do not known HintManager has been set in other place or not.
what i need is HintManager can add a static method to check whether HintManager has been seted.
@uffy The docker image has been released again, please try the latest version again, thanks.

@tristaZero  yeah, I can make  my pr https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/3768 run well, but how to do it with this revert PR and waiting for it has been merged to dev , then submit a new PR?
How about if the original string is not UTF8?

> @tristaZero yeah, I can make my pr #3768 run well, but how to do it with this revert PR and waiting for it has been merged to dev , then submit a new PR?

Yes, after this pr merged, init table SQL `INSERT INTO t_encrypt_contains_column VALUES(1, 'cipherValue', 'plainValue', 'cipherValue', 'plainValue')` will execute error.

> How about if the original string is not UTF8?

It will cause the result of decryption to be disorderly
@KomachiSion when your revert PR is merged, I'll sumbit a new PR to fixed it and add my unit test back.

> How about if the original string is not UTF8?

The encryption uses utf-8 encoding, but the decryption does not specify the encoding, and the default system encoding is used. When our system defaults encoding is GBK , the correct result cannot be obtained

> @KomachiSion when your revert PR is merged, I'll sumbit a new PR to fixed it and add my unit test back.

Thanks.
